text:
In general, what do people recommend as the "best" approach to serializing/deserializing tabular data (e.g. DataFrames) to/from disk?

Arrow.jl?

elements.text: In general, what do people recommend as the "best" approach to serializing/deserializing tabular data (e.g. DataFrames) to/from disk?

text: I'd say Arrow for a tabular format.  Parquet is much closer than anything else to being an "industry standard" for binary serialized data, but the Julia package is a bit rough

elements.text: I'd say Arrow for a tabular format.  Parquet is much closer than anything else to being an "industry standard" for binary serialized data, but the Julia package is a bit rough

text:
if you want something super fast and light and aren’t using a lot of different types, you might want to look into <@U6GD6JN2K>’s <https://github.com/xiaodaigh/JDF.jl>

works only with dataframes tho

note also that if you plan to use FileTrees.jl with this, there will be slightly more work and the docs don’t go into how (i’ll probably try to submit a PR for the docs sometime)
